Job Title: Accounting Manager/Supervisor

Location: Plano, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Description

If you're a practical Accounting Manager with a knack for establishing and regulating an organization's accounting and finance procedures, this could be the job for you! This is a position where employees feel appreciated in their day-to-day work and are rewarded for their efforts. This Accounting Manager position with a burgeoning, innovative company is for candidates who can take charge of daily operations, such as preparing and/or reviewing appropriate ledger entries and reconciliations, maintaining the general ledger system, preparing monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements, assisting with regulatory reporting as applicable, and related duties. This Accounting Manager role is based in the Plano, Texas area and is a permanent employment opportunity that is not to be missed! Apply today with Robert Half!

Key responsibilities

 Assist in the implementation of NetSuite Financials, including system and process design, data migration, testing, training, and go-forward system administration Prepare various technical accounting analyses, policies, and procedures Command sufficient knowledge of enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems Assist in the preparation of GAAP financial statements, including document preparation, data analysis, integrity validation, and reconciliation processes Review and analyze balance sheets and income statement accounts owned by the Senior Accountant Lead and supervise the accounting team performance during the closing process to ensure close deadlines are met Collaborate with FP& A and accounting management to deliver relevant and timely reporting of financial data analytics, including monthly flash report, key financial metrics, and actual spend against budgets/outlook


Requirements

 Month end closings experience desired Construction Accounting experience Strong familiarity with general ledger Command of Balance Sheet Account Reconciliation CPA or MBA preferred Exceptional communication skills that provide the ability to interact with all levels of the organization with a high customer service orientation Recent relevant financial experience Working knowledge of enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems is valuable Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business or equivalent degree and/or experience Ability to simplify complex problems and build solutions Solid technical skills
